Module downfall
Package net.dragondelve.ui.main.tabs

Class RealmScreenController

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.dragondelve.downfall.ui.main.tabs.RealmScreenController
  • public class RealmScreenController
extends java.lang.Object
    A controller that controls the content of the Realm Tab. It displays user's realm Data allowing the user to see a quick overview of the state of their realm. Controls /fxml/main/tabs/RealmScreenController.fxml and is annotated with @FXML where it references that FXML file.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initialize method that is called automatically after the FXML has finished loading. Initializes all UI elements before they are displayed

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates values on all labels if there was an action or an event that could have changed them. Also updates ImageViews and the tag table.

      • updateImageView

        private void updateImageView​(javafx.scene.layout.Pane container,
                             javafx.scene.image.Image image,
                             javafx.scene.image.ImageView imageView)
        Updates the given ImageView to contain the given Image, if image provided is not null, forces the width of the container to conform to the ImageView's Image width modified so that the image keeps its aspect ratio, plus some gaps that are defined in IMAGE_PANE_GAP. If the image equals to null it forces the ImageView to conform to IMAGE_PANE_HEIGHT in both Width and Height.
        Parameters:
        container - Container Pane that contains the ImageView. It will be resized to have a height of IMAGE_PANE_HEIGHT. It's width will depend on the aspect ratio of the Image provided.
        image - Image to be set into the ImageView. It's aspect ratio is used to define container's width.
        imageView - Image view to be set with a given image. It's best if ImageView's parent is the container argument, but it's not required.

      • forceDimensions

        private void forceDimensions​(javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane,
                             java.lang.Double height,
                             java.lang.Double width)
        Forces the dimension of the pane to conform to the parameters specified.
        Parameters:
        pane - Pane whose width and height you want to fix to particular values.
        height - Height to which you want to set the pane's height.
        width - Width to which you want to set the pane's width.

      • updateStabilityBar

        private void updateStabilityBar()
        Updates the Stability bar to display the current stability in a visual way.

      • updateStabilityPane

        private void updateStabilityPane​(javafx.scene.layout.Pane stabilityPane,
                                 javafx.scene.layout.BackgroundFill neutralFill,
                                 javafx.scene.layout.BackgroundFill activeFill,
                                 java.lang.Double threshold,
                                 java.lang.Boolean lessThanThreshold)
        Binds the background property to a new Background that is created with one of the two fills depending on whether the Stability of the realm "exceeds" the threshold given. "exceeds" for the purposes of this method means less than or equal to threshold if lessThanThreshold is true and greater or equal to the threshold if it is false.
        Parameters:
        stabilityPane - Pane whose background needs to be updated.
        neutralFill - BackgroundFill to be used if the userRealm's stability does not "exceed" the threshold.
        activeFill - BackgroundFill to be used if the userRealm's stability "exceeds" the threshold.
        threshold - Value of the threshold that needs to be "exceeded" in order for the active fill to be used instead of neutralFill.
        lessThanThreshold - Controls if the threshold is "exceeded" when the UserRealm's stability is less than or equal to, or greater than or equal to the threshold provided.
